text: hello my name is alex schrameyer and i'm
a specialist solutions architect for
amazon connect in this video i'd like to
talk about amazon connect voice id
voice id uses machine learning to
authenticate callers in real time it
also detects fraud risks and thus makes
voice interactions faster and more
secure
it does so directly within amazon
connect our omnichannel cloud-based
contact center
historically contact centers have used
two methods to authenticate callers
these were something that you have for
example the cvv on your credit card or a
one-time password sent to your mobile
device or something you know
for example your mother's maiden name or
the make and model of your first car
the issue with this is these pieces of
information can be stolen and used by
malicious actors
voice id was built to address these
concerns
voice id uses machine learning to
analyze a caller's unique voice
characteristics
such as pitch rhythm and loudness
once a caller is enrolled you can
authenticate your callers right in your
ivr and offer self-service options that
you would not have offered to an
unauthenticated caller
for calls that escalate to an agent the
authentication state is provided
allowing the agent to avoid cumbersome
authentication processes thus saving
time
we also allow agents to authenticate
callers by clicking a button in the
amazon connect software
let me show you what this looks like
i'll first show you what it looks like
to enroll a customer and voice id over
the phone
note you can also batch enroll customers
by importing recordings
the call is presented to the agent
who can see that the caller is not yet
enrolled in voice id
to meet with personal data protection
laws the contact center agent captures
the consent of the caller to use voice
id and begins the enrollment process
voice id enrollment requires 30 seconds
of customer speech excluding silence and
does not require any particular keywords
or phrases to be spoken
this allows enrollment to occur in the
background while the caller and agent
have a natural conversation
once enrollment is complete the agent
soft phone updates to reflect this
when calling the same contact center
again
voice id compares the caller's voice
print with the one enrolled earlier
it only requires between five and ten
seconds of the caller's voice to
authenticate
and the process generates a confidence
score which contact center
administrators can use to configure
different flows depending on the
authentication outcome
if the caller is verified in the ivr
they can take different self-service
paths than if they were not
if the call needs to escalate to an
agent the verification status is
displayed in the agent's cell phone
allowing the agent to easily determine
if additional verification is required
in this next demonstration
the caller will be connected to the
agent and the authentication status has
not yet been determined
the agent receives the call and can see
that the caller has not yet
authenticated and voice id needs to
gather more speech
the agent can begin the conversation to
better understand the reason for the
call and in a few seconds the
authentication state will be updated
voice id requires 5 to 10 seconds of
caller speech to provide a result at
which point the conversation can move to
discuss sensitive information voice id
doesn't rely on the caller answering
multiple security questions as you just
saw it makes it easy to enroll and
verify customers without changing the
natural flow of their conversation and
improves their experience
we also improve the agent experience by
providing an integrated agent interface
for verifying caller identity
finally
voice id can be used as an additional
security layer in the ivr to
authenticate customers without any human
intervention
this empowers you to provide your
customers self-service options for a
wider range of issues
we also allow you to upload audio
recordings into the system to create
custom watch lists and detect fraudsters
that wraps up this demo
you can easily set up and configure
voice biometrics for your amazon connect
instance
to do so first enable voice id in the
aws console for your amazon connect
instance and then configure
authentication and fraud risk detection
using the drag and drop functionality of
contact flow blocks
for more information please visit
aws.com
connect slash voice id or reach out to
your aws sales specialist
